intro: Calotis muelleri, commonly known as the Mueller's burr, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny, ball-like seed capsules that enclose numerous seeds. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and usually pink or white, appearing in clusters along the stems. Calotis muelleri is often found in sandy soils and is used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
